item.title: Utawarerumono: Shiro e no Michishirube latest information broadcast set for November 22
item.content:encoded:
Utawarerumono: Lost Flag sixth anniversary broadcast to follow.

item.title: Silent Hill f version 1.10 update now available, adds ‚ÄòCasual‚Äô action difficulty
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Plus, skip select sections of New Game+.

Publisher Konami and developer NeoBards Entertainment have released the version 1.10 update for Silent Hill f, which adds the new action difficulty ‚ÄúCasual,‚Äù an optional skip feature for select sections of New Game+, and more.

Get the patch notes below.

New Features

  • Added Action Difficulty: Casual
    • The Casual action difficulty will be playable when starting a game from ‚ÄúNew Game‚Äù on the main menu or from a New Game+ save file.
    • For players on the Story action difficulty or higher, the Casual action difficulty will be selectable upon reaching the Game Over screen multiple times.
  • Added Optional Skip Feature for Select Sections of New Game+
    • Upon completing the ‚ÄúGo through the door‚Äù objective after solving the mural puzzle on New Game+, the game will display the option to skip. The game will resume at the scene where Hinako awakens at the corridor of the Dark Shrine for the second time with the ‚ÄúProceed‚Äù objective if skipped.
    • Items from the skipped sections will not be collected.
      • ‚ÄúThankful to Be Here,‚Äù ‚ÄúGrateful for a Worthy Foe,‚Äù and ‚ÄúClear Skies‚Äù do not unlock on a playthrough that uses the skip feature.
      • The skip feature does not impact branching paths or endings.
  • Added Motion Blur Option to the Graphics Menu (PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series versions only)

System Changes

  • Hinako‚Äôs stamina replenishes slightly faster
  • Unskippable combat encounters are reduced across multiple sections
  • Fewer enemies are placed across multiple sections
  • Hinako‚Äôs line when an enemy is defeated plays at a slightly later time
  • Hinako takes slightly less damage on the Hard action difficulty

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed bug where Shu duplicates in the cutscene that plays when heading from Sennensugi Shrine to Rinko‚Äôs house during the ‚ÄúHead to Rinko‚Äôs house‚Äù objective.
  • Fixed bug where interaction icons do not display on the hall leading to the room with the naginata during the ‚ÄúEnter the inner room‚Äù objective.
  • Fixed bug where the Sakuko-like entity stops moving in combat during the ‚ÄúDefeat the Sakuko-like entity‚Äù objective.
  • Fixed bug where the Fog Monster stops moving and halts progress during the ‚ÄúChase after the Fog Monster‚Äù objective.
  • Fixed bugs across multiple levels where events do not progress despite meeting the required conditions.
  • Fixed bugs across multiple levels where specific enemies remain outside of the combat area and cannot be defeated.
  • Fixed bugs across multiple levels where clumps of flesh do not spawn.
  • Fixed bug where some notes from ‚ÄúSakuko‚Äôs Diary‚Äù could not be obtained on New Game+.
  • Fixed bug where Hinako may become unresponsive to player input after dodging.
  • Fixed bug where Hinako dies upon loading an autosave file if Hinako died during an autosave.
  • Fixed bug where the ‚ÄúView Endings‚Äù option does not display on the title screen after finishing the first playthrough (may require loading New Game+ data to fix).
  • Fixed bug where Indirect Lighting and Reflections revert to On during cutscenes even when set to Off in the Graphics menu (PC version only).
  • Fixed bug where the cursor moves without player input when playing on the controller.
  • Various other minor bugs have been fixed, including bugs related to audio, hitboxes, text errors, loading, and graphics.

Silent Hill f is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Microsoft Store.

item.title: Palworld Mobile closed alpha test set for December
item.content:encoded:
• Smartphone

Registration now available.

KRAFTON will host a closed alpha test for Palworld Mobile in December, the company announced. Sign-ups are available now via the game‚Äôs official website until November 26.

Here is an overview of the game, via KRAFTON:

About

Action Adventure with Pals! Be the first to make history!

Palworld Mobile is a mobile adaptation of the Palworld intellectual property, reimagining the world and core gameplay of the global hit for mobile platforms. Embark on a new adventure with mysterious creatures called Pals‚Äîexplore vast open fields, survive harsh environments, craft tools and items, and engage in dynamic combat.

Key Features

  • Survival ‚Äì Survive the dangers of starvation, the cold, and formidable foes alongside mysterious creatures called ‚ÄúPals‚Äù while exploring a vast world filled with them. Pals you capture in the field can become your loyal allies in battle, but in dire times, they might also just end up on your dinner table.
  • Combat ‚Äì Aiming and pulling the trigger is your job, but changing the tide of battle is up to power of Pals who‚Äôve been thrown into the fight. From devastating firepower to life-saving healing when you need it most‚ÄîPals don‚Äôt have to be your battle companions. Survival is all that matters, whether Pals serve as weapons or healing potions.
  • Crafting ‚Äì Gather materials to craft tools and buildings essential for your survival. From wooden clubs to guns, and from Primitive Workbenches to large factories‚Äîyour precious Pals who once lent you a helping hand (or paw) in building your first humble base will soon become part of your much greater ‚Äúlabor force.‚Äù
  • Together ‚Äì Breed and hatch Pals in the Plaza, battle against other players, and challenge mighty bosses. ‚ÄúUnited we stand,‚Äù is how the saying goes, but‚Ä¶ there are always those who just want to watch the world burn.

item.title: NCSOFT announces MMORPG Horizon Steel Frontiers for PC, iOS, and Android
item.content:encoded:
And here are some comments from NCSOFT chief corporate officer Taekjin Kim, Guerrilla Games studio director Jan-Bart van Beek, and NCSOFT executive producer Sung-Gu Lee, via the announcement video:

Taekjin Kim, NCSOFT Chief Corporate Officer

‚ÄúWhen I fist experienced Horizon Zero Dawn in 2017, I was instantly drawn into its vibrant and captivating world. The battles against colossal machine lifeforms were exhilarating and the mysterious narrative sparked my curiosity, urging me to explore every corner of that universe. Yet I couldn‚Äôt help but feel a little wistful that such an incredible world had to be experienced alone. I imagined how thrilling it would be to meet others, to team up and face these massive machines together.

‚ÄúFrom the beginning, I was convinced: battling machine lifeforms would be far more exciting than facing any fantasy monster. That vision inspired us to create an MMO set in this extraordinary universe. And today, I‚Äôm proud to present Horizon Steel Frontiers‚Äîa dream realized. Horizon Steel Frontiers represents a new challenge for NC, and the start of an exciting journey ahead. We hope you look forward to this new Horizon born from the collaboration between NC and Guerrilla.‚Äù

Jan-Bart van Beek, Guerrilla Games Studio Director

‚ÄúI was the one who originally came up with the concept of the Horizon franchise. The Horizon franchise is incredibly special to me and to everyone at Guerrilla. It‚Äôs a world we‚Äôve poured our hearts and souls into. It‚Äôs a place where humanity, nature, and technology are constantly colliding. It‚Äôs become a vibrant and living world full of stories, tribal cultures, and of course, those incredible animal-like machines that rule the land.

‚ÄúFrom the very beginning of creating this franchise, we‚Äôve imagined the Horizon universe as one that could be experienced in many different ways. Horizon Steel Frontiers is a full-fledged MMORPG that NCSOFT has built specifically for mobile. With Steel Frontiers, you can step into this world, anywhere, anytime.

‚ÄúPlayers take on the role of machine hunters, chasing opportunity in a region called the Deadlands, which is inspired by Arizona and New Mexico. You‚Äôre sharing the frontier with thousands of other players, sometimes working together to take down machines, and other times competing with rival tribes or fighting over resources. And that mix of cooperation and competition creates moments you could never script.

‚ÄúAt the heart of the Horizon story is the search for the balance between humanity, nature, and technology. Sometimes that‚Äôs harmony, sometimes that‚Äôs conflict. But it always creates a world filled with mystery and beauty. What we want players to feel is the world‚Äôs resilience and its hope. And that even when everything seems overwhelming, humanity can adapt, can survive, and find meaning in the world.

‚ÄúWe already had groups at Guerrilla playing Horizon Steel Frontiers together at the office, and it‚Äôs really amazing. Whenever I get a chance to jump in on an early gameplay test, what really stands out is Steel Frontiers‚Äò distinct tone and atmosphere. It has a unique identity of its own, and has been brought to life by NCSOFT‚Äôs developers. But it fits perfectly with the Horizon universe, and that balance with the essence of Horizon and something fresh is what really excites me about this project.‚Äù

Sung-Gu Lee, NCSOFT Executive Producer

‚ÄúI‚Äôm a bit nervous to present this project to the world for the first time, but at the same time, I‚Äôm extremely excited. The core concept of Horizon Steel Frontiers can be summed up in one phrase: the thrill of taking down colossal machines. Hunting massive machines was one of the greatest appeals of the original Horizon series. And now, we‚Äôre expanding that experience into the world of MMORPGs.

‚ÄúOur main focus is designing a new combat experience tailored for an MMORPG. In Horizon Steel Frontiers, we‚Äôve added unique, original gameplay elements to the process of taking down giant machines. For example, after destroying a specific part of a machine, you can quickly approach and climb onto it using a Pullcaster, set traps on the damaged part, and inflict status effects. During battle, you can even pick up weapons dropped by the machine, carry them on your mount, and use them in subsequent fights. At the heart of giant machine hunts are two core values. cooperation and strategy. Players must take on their roles, act strategically, and work together seamlessly. These combat mechanics truly shine in large-scale battles, offering the scale and dynamism that only an MMORPG can provide.

‚ÄúIn Horizon Steel Frontiers, every player is a hero. We‚Äôve put great care into customization, allowing you to fully express your individuality‚Äîeven down to the smallest details. During character creation, we‚Äôve incorporated the tribes from the original Horizon world. You can choose from diverse tribes such as Nora, Tenakth, Utaru, or Oseram, and create your character based on your preferred tribe. Our system provides a high degree of freedom, so you can design your character exactly as you envision‚Äîfrom facial features, body type, and hair, to makeup and finer details. The characters you create can be shared with other players, allowing you not only to show off your own style, but also draw inspiration from others to further customize your hero. Step into Horizon Steel Frontiers as a truly unique machine hunter, crafted entirely by you, and explore a world where your individuality matters.

‚ÄúIn the world of Horizon Steel Frontiers, you‚Äôll be able to develop your own character, team up with friends to hunt colossal machines, and live the story of a machine hunter in the Deadlands. We can‚Äôt wait to see you all become the heroes of this adventure, and we‚Äôre doing our best to make that day come as soon as possible.‚Äù

Watch the announcement video and gameplay trailer below.

item.title: Death Stranding Isolations animated series announced
item.content:encoded:
• Anime

Streaming exclusively on Disney+ in 2027.

Kojima Productions has announced Death Stranding Isolations (working title), an animated series project produced by E&H production. It will stream exclusively on Disney+ in 2027.

The series will tell a new story that follows a young man and woman as they set out on an adventure. It follows in the footsteps of the Death Stranding video game in spirit and ideas, and depicts the world through a ‚Äúbold and yet subtle touch and top-class hand-drawn animation.‚Äù

Here is the story synopsis and staff list:

Story Synopsis

Once, there was an explosion‚Ä¶

Lonesome souls of the dead manifest in the physical world, reaching in search of the living. However, the connection they create triggers a massive explosion that eradicates anything of this world‚Äîa phenomenon referred to as the Death Stranding. These events wipe out nations as well as civilization itself. People who remain are now isolated, withdrawn, and without connections. As humanity stands at the brink a legendary porter set out to transport both cargo and wishes of its senders, reconnecting people in the hope that they might still be saved.

Based on the video game born out of the mind of legendary game creator, Hideo Kojima, comes a new animation series headed by Japan‚Äôs up-and-coming animation studio E&H production. Helmed by E&H‚Äôs Takayuki Sano, it follows in the footsteps of the original in spirit and ideas and depict the world of Death Stranding through a bold and yet subtle touch and top-class hand-drawn animation.

Somewhere in North America, just as Sam Bridges walks through the continent in order to save America, the someones are also trying to deal with their isolation in their own way. An old man trying to realize salvation through ways outside of the connection advocated by Bridges. A female warrior who tries to kickstart a world of constant fighting. A boy with a grudge against Bridges. A girl who embraces loneliness.

On the precipice of the end of humanity and the world, their fates and hopes converge, as another story of Death Stranding begins.

And now, comes another explosion‚Ä¶

Staff

  • Executive Producer: Hideo Kojima
  • Director: Takayuki Sano
  • Original Character Design: Ilya Kuvshinov
  • Animation Production: E&H production

item.title: SANABI free DLC ‚ÄòA Haunted Day‚Äô launches November 27 for PC, later for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

Story set 13 years prior to the events of the main game.

SANABI free downloadable content expansion ‚ÄúA Haunted Day‚Äù will launch for PC via Steam on November 27, followed by Switch at a later date, publisher NEOWIZ and developer Wonder Potion announced.

Here is an overview of the content, via NEOWIZ:

About

‚ÄúA Haunted Day‚Äù takes place prior to the events of the base game and centers on Major Song during her time at Uigeumbu No. 12 as she follows a lead into a treacherous scrapyard. Unlike the grappling mechanics in the base game, the downloadable content‚Äôs combat gameplay combines recoverable jumps with the raw power of Song‚Äôs shotgun for spectacular aerial maneuvers.

The first spin-off downloadable content of SANABI, packed with thrilling action expanding on the main story.

The downloadable content includes eight new stages and two boss fights.

Story

13 years ago, under an unreasonable order from her superior, Major Song headed to a suspicious scrapyard outside of Hanyang.

What awaited her there was a hail of bullets, explosions‚Ä¶ and a general with a steel tiger?

The New Playable Character: Major Song

The playable character of this spin-off is Major Song, during her time serving in Uigeumbu No.12, before she met the General.

Stylish and Agile ‚ÄúAerial Action‚Äù Platformer

Major Song can perform agile aerial maneuvers with precision. Combined with her unique abilities‚Äîa recoverable mid-air jump and expert use of a shotgun‚Äîshe becomes a formidable opponent, even against a General.

From Burst Mode, which defends against enemy attacks and boosts the power of all actions, to the enhanced shotgun that deals massive damage‚Ä¶

Play as Major Song, who is the youngest to ever pass the martial exam, a government-certified living weapon!

Spin-Off Scenario: A Haunted Day

Operation 3 was issued at an assault robot scrapyard, outside of Hanyang.

Major Song found a clue to the treason. She dives into this massive scrapyard with confidence, but something about this place feels‚Ä¶ off.

There are maniacally aggressive robots and a disturbingly ominous signaling device.

A superior giving unreasonable orders, a scrapyard plagued by strange phenomena, and‚Ä¶ a general with a steel tiger?

Today, it feels like haunted or something

What‚Äôs happening in this scrapyard?
